p: Our previously reported data on E. umbellata verifies its antioxidant, antidiabetic, anticholinesterase, and neuroprotective potentials [ 13, 14]. Some of the compounds present in the essential oil of E. umbellata (Fig. 7) have already been confirmed to possess neuroprotective activities for instance, the cis-cis-9,12-Octadecadienoic acid (Linoleic acid) [ 55]. In the same manner α-linolenic acid [ 56], caryophyllene [ 57], octadecanoic acid (stearic acid) [ 58], and decanoic acid have been recently reported to have strong neuroprotective activities [ 59]. Although a number of chemical compounds are present in the essential oil of E. umbellata, the most active compounds responsible for the observed biological activities were nominated based on reported studies in literature [ 55– 59].
